q: What has to be broken before you can use it?
I'm tall when I'm young, and I'm short when I'm old. What am I?
What month of the year has 28 days?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
What question can you never answer yes to?
What gets wet while drying?
What can you keep after giving to someone?
I have branches, but no fruit, trunk or leaves. What am I?
The more of this there is, the less you see. What is it?
What has many keys but can't open a single lock?
Where does today come before yesterday?
What has a head and a tail but no body?
What has a neck but no head?
What goes up but never comes down?
What belongs to you, but other people use it more than you?
What has hands but cannot clap?
What has legs but cannot walk?
What has one eye but cannot see?
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
What begins with T, ends with T, and has T in it?
What kind of room has no doors or windows?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
Which letter of the alphabet has the most water?
What starts with a P, ends with an E, and has thousands of letters?
What begins with an E but only has one letter?
I am an odd number. Take away a letter and I become even. What number am I?
If you drop me I'm sure to crack, but give me a smile and I'll always smile back. What am I?
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What are they?
What turns everything around but does not move?
What can you catch but not throw?
What has teeth but cannot bite?
What has words but never speaks?
What runs but never walks, has a mouth but never talks?
What can fill a room but takes up no space?
What has four wheels and flies?
What gets bigger the more you take away?
What comes down but never goes up?
What has a bottom at the top?
What can run but never walks, has a bed but never sleeps?
What has an eye but cannot see?
What has cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and water but no fish?
I have no life, but I can die. What am I?
What can you hold in your right hand but never in your left?
What gets sharper the more you use it?
What has ears but cannot hear?
I'm not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air. What am I?
What invention lets you look right through a wall?
What can be cracked, made, told, and played?
What has a ring but no finger?
I shave every day, but my beard stays the same. Who am I?
What two things can you never eat for breakfast?

What word in the English language does the following: the first two letters signify a male, the first three letters signify a female, the first four letters signify a great, while the entire word signifies a great woman?
What disappears as soon as you say its name?
You see me once in June, twice in November, and not at all in May. What am I?
A girl fell off a 30-foot ladder but didn't get hurt. Why?
a: She fell off the bottom step

q: What word is spelled wrong in every dictionary?
What five-letter word becomes shorter when you add two letters to it?
How many letters are in the alphabet?
What has 13 hearts but no other organs?
What building has the most stories?
What can you break even if you never pick it up or touch it?
A man who was outside in the rain without an umbrella or hat didn't get a single hair on his head wet. Why?
What is seen in the middle of March and April that can't be seen at the beginning or end of either month?
What goes through cities and fields, but never moves?
I am always hungry and will die if not fed, but whatever I touch will soon turn red. What am I?
What can you hold in your left hand but not in your right?
What is 3/7 chicken, 2/3 cat, and 2/4 goat?
What is cut on a table, but is never eaten?
What word contains 26 letters but only has three syllables?
Where do you find roads without cars, forests without trees, and cities without houses?
I am not alive, but I grow. I don't have lungs, but I need air. I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
What is harder to catch the faster you run?
What word starts with E and ends with E but only has one letter in it?
What is so fragile that saying its name breaks it?
What is always in front of you but can't be seen?
What kind of coat is best put on wet?
If you have me, you want to share me. If you share me, you don't have me. What am I?
What tastes better than it smells?
What has a thumb and four fingers but is not alive?
The person who makes it sells it. The person who buys it never uses it. The person who uses it never knows they're using it. What is it?
What can you put in a bucket to make it weigh less?
What do you throw out when you want to use it but take in when you don't want to use it?
What bow can't be tied?
What type of cheese is made backward?
A bus driver goes the wrong way on a one-way street. He passes the cops, but they don't stop him. Why?
What has one head, one foot, and four legs?
What can you serve but never eat?
What can't talk but will reply when spoken to?
What has a face and two hands but no arms or legs?
What always goes to bed with its shoes on?
What do you buy to eat but never consume?
What flies without wings?
What side of a cat has the most fur?
What do you call a bear with no teeth?
What has a spine but no bones?
What is orange and sounds like a parrot?
What do you call a fish without eyes?
What stays where it is when it goes off?
What kind of tree can you carry in your hand?
David's father has three sons: Snap, Crackle, and ___?
What do you call a dinosaur that crashes their car?
What goes around the world but stays in a corner?
What is black and white and read all over?
What loses its head in the morning and gets it back at night?
What kind of band never plays music?
What is tall when young and short when old?
What do you find at the end of a rainbow?
Why did the teddy bear say no to dessert?
What is black when you buy it, red when you use it, and gray when you throw it away?
